name: peripherally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not as important or as closely involved as other people or things: Politics, at least peripherally, have always been part of the Olympics. peripherally involved My wife was in charge of this project, but I was only peripherally involved.
at the edge of something: The condition has impaired her vision so that she can see objects only peripherally. The task involves monitoring lights which are either centrally or peripherally located.
medical
  specialized Medical treatment that is given peripherally goes into the body through the arms or legs, not into the main part of the body: The patient had to have a peripherally inserted central catheter placed in his arm. It is administered peripherally as an isotonic solution.
More examplesFewer examplesHe was only peripherally aware of all this.This question is not central, but is peripherally relevant to the dispute.This kind of tumour usually develops peripherally and spreads quickly.
